quote: If you aren’t experiencing failure, then you are making a far worse mistake: You are being driven by the desire to avoid it.
author: Ed Catmull, President of Pixar, Inc. and Disney Animation

quote: It's really hard to design products by focus groups. A lot of times, people don't know what they want until you show it to them.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: The hierarchy will begin to reinforce its own structure by hiring people who fit its shape, adding people to fill subordinate support roles.
author: The Valve Employee Handbook, Developers of Half-Life, Portal, Left 4 Dead and Steam

quote: ...if you're afraid to change something it is clearly poorly designed.
author: Martin Fowler

quote: You may encounter many defeats, but you must not be defeated. In fact, it may be necessary to encounter the defeats, so you can know who you are, what you can rise from, how you can still come out of it.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Ease of use with equivalent performance varies with the square root of the cost of development. That means that to design a computer that's ten times easier to use would cost 100 times as much.
author: Robert Cringeley

quote: Someone’s misfortune can become someone else’s luck.
author: Sam Regenstrief

quote: Requirements are like water. They're easier to build on when they're frozen.
author: Anonymous

quote: ... with proper design, the features come cheaply. This approach is arduous, but continues to succeed.
author: Dennis Ritchie

quote: Your assumptions are your windows on the world. Scrub them off every once in a while, or the light won't come in.
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: When it comes to creative inspiration, job titles and hierarchy are meaningless.
author: Ed Catmull, President of Pixar, Inc. and Disney Animation

quote: Creativity is intelligence having fun.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Restlessness is discontent — and discontent is the first necessity of progress. Show me a thoroughly satisfied man — and I will show you a failure.
author: Thomas Edison

quote: There are many ways of going forward, but only one way of standing still
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: An idea that is not dangerous is unworthy of being called an idea at all.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: You don’t build it for yourself. You know what the people want and you build it for them.
author: Walt Disney

quote: The kind of environment that we developed Google in, the reason that we were able to develop a search engine, is the web was so open. Once you get too many rules, that will stifle innovation.
author: Sergey Brin

quote: You must do the thing you think you cannot do.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Sometimes when you innovate, you make mistakes. It is best to admit them quickly, and get on with improving your other innovations.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: If I had asked people what they wanted, they would have said faster horses.
author: Henry Ford

quote: Because, you know, resilience – if you think of it in terms of the Gold Rush, then you’d be pretty depressed right now because the last nugget of gold would be gone. But the good thing is, with innovation, there isn’t a last nugget. Every new thing creates two new questions and two new opportunities.
author: Jeff Bezos

quote: The most important property of a program is whether it accomplishes the intention of its user.
author: C.A.R. Hoare

quote: Measuring programming progress by lines of code is like measuring aircraft building progress by weight.
author: Bill Gates

quote: One of my most productive days was throwing away 1000 lines of code.
author: Ken Thompson

quote: It takes a huge effort to free yourself from memory, but when you succeed, you start to realize that you're capable of far more than you imagined.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: Failure is simply the opportunity to begin again, this time more intelligently.
author: Henry Ford

quote: You may say I'm a dreamer, but I'm not the only one.
author: John Lennon

quote: Any sufficiently advanced technology is equivalent to magic.
author: Arthur C. Clarke

quote: Just because something doesn’t do what you planned it to do doesn’t mean it’s useless.
author: Thomas Edison

quote: Computers are useless. They can only give you answers.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: The art challenges the technology, and the technology inspires the art.
author: John Lasseter

quote: Never stand begging for that which you have the power to earn.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: If you fell down yesterday, stand up today.
author: H.G. Wells
